column4: I have a question about samba and setting it up so that my XP machine can map a drive to it
I've done this successfully, how can I help you
it's installed and I've setup the user, but I still cannot connect from my XP machine
On the XP box, you get nothing? No authentication window popping up?
when you try to access the samba share that is
the authenticaton pops up, but it's not registering the user and pass that I created
I try to map the drive, and the authentication pops up.  but when I put in the user and password it won't let me in
I'd like to see your smb.conf file...
did you create a samba user with the smbpasswd command?
are they any changes needed for the smb.conf file?
I don't know because I usually create the smb.conf file from scratch
when installing using the sudo apt-get install samba, the file is created on it's own
Yes I know, but I usually delete it and use my own instead
any good sites where someone posted a good one?
can you access the share from another Ubuntu box
